text: Unlike other AirPod models,
the AirPods Pro have silicone tips

that are supposed to bend
to the shape of your ears.
But everyone has slightly different ears,
and the default tips won't always fit.
That's why every new pair of AirPods Pro
come with three sets of silicone ear tips,
each one a different size.
You can remove your AirPods' current tips

by pinching firmly and
pulling them off the earbuds.
It takes some force, but don't worry.
They'll pop off without issue.

If you're concerned about
ripping the silicone,
invert the tip before you begin.

Choose a new pair of
ear tips from the box:
small, medium, or large.

The tips that come attached
to your AirPods Pro earbuds

when you first open the
box are the medium size.

If you find that they frequently
fall out of your ears,
try going down a size.

If they hurt or irritate your
ears, try going up in size.

Each ear tip has a letter
marking on the inside
to identify its size.
To attach the new pair of tips,
line up the oval on the edge of the tips
with the oval on the AirPods' speaker

and gently press the tip in
until it clicks into place.

If you're not sure which
size ear tip to use,
take the ear tip fit test.

With your AirPods on and
connected to your phone,

open the settings app,
then click "Bluetooth,"
then click the i next to your AirPods,
then click "Ear Tip Fit Test."

You'll be led through a
series of short exercises

that test how well the
AirPods fit your ears.
If it determines that the seal is tight

and allows for adequate
noise cancellation,

then the image of the
AirPod on your screen

will say "Good Seal"
in green underneath it.
If not, it will turn yellow instead

and read "Adjust or Try
a Different Ear Tip."

Try a different-sized
tip and rerun the test.
